author: Staff Reporter
text:
As they marched a brief stretch of an arterial road in central Kolkata on Monday, the alumni of Jawaharlal Nehru University, now prominent leaders of the Congress and the Communist Party of India (Marxist), successfully gave two messages to the electorate. Under the banner ‘#KolkataMarchesforJNU’ the leaders on one hand alleged that “the BJP and the RSS are attempting to foist and foster their narrow ideology” in the country and on the other presented a united face of the Congress-Left alliance to the people of the State.

State Congress secretary and the rally convener, Omprakash Mishra (JNU alumnus), said “the arrest shows that freedom of speech was under attack.” CPI(M) MP and JNU alumnus, Ritabrata Banerjee, said people had hit the streets in protest against the “undeclared Emergency.”

Asked whether the rally would boost the prospect of a Left-Congress alliance, Mr. Banerjee said the march had nothing to do with politics. But he was quick to point out, “The alliance of the people is ready to oust the undemocratic Mamata government from Bengal.”
title: Cong., Left bonhomie to the fore at rally
